channel.title: chemical engineering on The Simon Research Ensemble
channel.description: Recent content in chemical engineering on The Simon Research Ensemble

item.title: dynamic models for liquid flow into/out of tanks with complicated geometries
item.description: author: Cory Simon Problem setup Liquid continuously flows into a truncated square pyramidal tank at a rate $q_i=q_i(t)$ [m$^3$/s]. Hydrostatic pressure drives flow out of the tank through a narrow pipe at its base; via Bernoulli’s equation, the outlet flow rate $q\propto \sqrt{h}$, where $h$ [m] is the liquid level in the tank. The goal here is to derive a dynamic model for the liquid level $h=h(t)$ given any input $q_i(t)$.
